paragraph.paragraph:
All development windows are composed of two major components, each of which can be centered on a given "address" (either a cluster, a class or a feature). One is the editor, with which go all the peripheral tools (including the
../20_cluster_tool/00_introduction.xml cluster tool and the
../30_feature_tool/00_introduction.xml feature tool ). The other is the context tool, which contains for example the
../../80_formatters/00_introduction.xml class and feature tabs , the
../../50_diagram_tool/00_introduction.xml diagram tool and the
../../60_metric_tool/00_introduction.xml metric tool .

It is possible to either link both components so that they share the same address (allowing to immediately have extended information on the class that is being edited), or to unlink them (allowing to have extended information on any class while editing a class).

When both are linked, only the
10_main_address_bar.xml main address bar appears, whereas when they are unlinked, the
20_context_tool_address_bar.xml context tool address bar is also displayed, since it might point to a different location than the main address bar.

The
30_switch_data_share_mode.xml toggle data mode command allows you to switch between both modes.
